tweet_text: Here’s my latest congressional e-newsletter – Where Do We All Go From Here? – updating our further $1.9 trillion COVID-19 emergency relief, our H.R. 1/For The People Act and more, along with another anonymous online survey.

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text: Very concerning new report from our independent nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office: we have one of the highest burdens ever of total debt to GDP (overall economy) at 100%, we’re on track to the highest ever inside ten years, and it'll double to almost 200% in just 30 years.

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text: Regardless of when and how the Trump Presidency ends, the governance of our country and the representation of our Hawai’I in Congress for which I am responsible must and will continue.

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text: I urge Vice President Pence and the Cabinet to invoke the 25th Amendment to our Constitution, which provides an expedited procedure to remove the President for such disability. I am also reviewing specific impeachment proposals if the 25th Amendment is not invoked.

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text: The power of the Presidency is immense, and its continued abuse cannot be risked. And the precedent of acceding to such abuse cannot be accepted.

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text:
The President’s recent actions, including his flagrant attempted subversion of our election process and his incitement of yesterday’s violent attack on our U.S. Capitol, cross any reasonable line into an assault on our very foundations. 

https://t.co/tbG0FXuBzO

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text:
Please join me and my special guest, new Honolulu City Council Chair Tommy Waters, this coming Monday at 6:30pm. Details above. 
 
Imua America!

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text:
I was going to post this before today’s attack on our U.S. Capitol and I’m damn well going to post this now.
 
The 117th Congress (2021-2023) has commenced and its time for me to again talk story with you on my activities and your questions and guidance. https://t.co/BVW4YN5IPq

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text: And here in DC, on Capitol Hill, tonight or tomorrow or however long it takes, and regardless of what it takes, my colleagues and I will complete our constitutional duty and confirm the results of the Presidential election.

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text: But I know this is not our America, and I know we will get through this dark time together.

name: Rep. Ed Case
tweet_text:
My staff and I are ok, but democracy is not. 

What a truly dark moment for our country, born of disrespect for our very foundations and institutions and incited by the highest levels of our leadership.
